modifier.name: alternate benefit
modifier.notes: Bonus to rolls to survive made by plants in your care.

modifier.name: alternate benefit
modifier.notes: Bonus to HT rolls for a specific patient and condition if treated full time.

modifier.name: alternate benefit
modifier.notes: Bonus to HT rolls for a specific patient and condition if treated full time.

modifier.name: alternate benefit
modifier.notes: Bonus to resist deception involving numbers

modifier.name: alternate benefit
modifier.notes: Bonus to first influence roll made against one or more audience members after a successful performance.

modifier.name: alternate benefit
modifier.notes: Bonus to HT rolls to avoid harm from failure of covered skills
Con artists, politicians, salesmen, etc. – but only if you aren’t trying to manipulate them.
modifier.name: reaction bonus
effects: highly addictive (-5 on withdrawal roll)
effects: totally addictive (-10 on withdrawal roll)

disadvantages.name: bad sight (farsighted)
disadvantages.notes: -6 to Vision rolls to spot items within 1 yd; -3 DX to any close manual task, including close combat

disadvantages.name: bad sight (nearsighted)
disadvantages.notes: -6 to Vision rolls to spot items more than 1 yd away; -2 to all melee attacks; double actual distance to the target when calculating the range modifier for ranged attacks

disadvantages.name: blindness
disadvantages.notes: -6 to all combat skills; cannot target hit locations

disadvantages.name: chronic pain
disadvantages.notes: -2 to DX, IQ and self-control rolls

modifier.name: mild
modifier.notes: -2 to DX, IQ, and self-control rolls

modifier.name: severe
modifier.notes: -4 to DX, IQ, and self-control rolls

modifier.name: agonizing
modifier.notes: -6 to DX, IQ, and self-control rolls

disadvantages.name: chummy
disadvantages.notes: React to others at +2; -1 to IQ-based skills when alone

disadvantages.name: chummy (gregarious)
disadvantages.notes: React to others at +4; -2 to IQ-based skills when alone, or -1 in a group of 4 or less

modifier.name: frequency: constantly
modifier.notes: Lose 1 HP per minute without it

modifier.name: frequency: hourly
modifier.notes: Lose 1 HP per 10 minutes after missing a hourly dose

modifier.name: frequency: daily
modifier.notes: Lose 1 HP per hour after missing a daily dose

modifier.name: frequency: weekly
modifier.notes: Lose 1 HP per six hours after missing a weekly dose

modifier.name: frequency: monthly
modifier.notes: Lose 1 HP per day after missing a monthly dose

modifier.name: frequency: seasonally
modifier.notes: Lose 1 HP per 3 days after missing a seasonal dose

modifier.name: frequency: yearly
modifier.notes: Lose 1 HP per 2 weeks after missing a yearly dose

modifier.name: aging
modifier.notes: Age 2 years for each HP lost due to this dependency

disadvantages.name: insomniac (mild)
disadvantages.notes: GM secretly rolls 3d for the number of days between episodes

disadvantages.name: insomniac (severe)
disadvantages.notes: GM secretly rolls 2d-1 for the number of days between episodes

disadvantages.name: intolerance (@class, ethnicity, nationality, religion, sex, or species@)

modifier.name: frequency: three to five times daily
people affected
modifier.notes: Almost everyone except @large class of people@

disadvantages.name: social stigma (minority group)
disadvantages.notes: -2 Reaction from others; +2 Reaction in own group
